result.execSummary:
The defendant James W Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James W Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
1:40 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty J. Steven Heil.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to the charge.  Atty Heil concurs.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as domestic.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Heil.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

Domestic violence counseling
court costs

Court adjourned at 1:46 p.m.

9:00 a.m.  No appearance by the defnedant.  Aty J. Steven Heil present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Heil has a settlement and requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled approx 30 days out.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on April 7, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:01 a.m.
No Abusive or Violent Contact with Karen D.
Status hearing on March 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
No Abusive or Violent Contact with Karen D.

1:44 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty J. Steven Heil.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Heil confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Heil enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00  signature bond and conditions of:  No Abusive or Violent contact with Karen D.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 9, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.  Cash bond is to be returned to the poster.

Court adjourned at 1:46 p.m.
